channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17288] Add warn log for huge Cell and huge row
item.description:
Some log examples from our production cluster.


2016-12-10,17:08:11,478 WARN org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreScanner: adding a HUGE KV into result list, kv size:1253360, kv:105671140000001-1-c/R:r1/1481360887152/Put/vlen=1253245/ts=923099, from table XXXXX

2016-12-10,17:08:16,724 WARN org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreScanner: adding a HUGE KV into result list, kv size:1048680, kv:0220459/I:i_0/1481360889551/Put/vlen=1048576/ts=13642, from table XXXXXX
item.summary: Add warn log for huge Cell and huge row

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

This message was automatically generated.

The logging improvement is ok, but this patch changes whitespace unnecessarily and includes this:


@@ -591,16 +607,11 @@ public class StoreScanner extends NonReversedNonLazyKeyValueScanner

 

             // Update local tracking information

             count++;

-            totalBytesRead += CellUtil.estimatedSerializedSizeOf(cell);

+            checkKvSize(cell);

 

             // Update the progress of the scanner context

             scannerContext.incrementSizeProgress(CellUtil.estimatedHeapSizeOf(cell));

             scannerContext.incrementBatchProgress(1);

-

-            if (matcher.isUserScan() && totalBytesRead > maxRowSize) {

-              throw new RowTooBigException(

-                  "Max row size allowed: " + maxRowSize + ", but the row is bigger than that.");

-            }

           }

which is a unrelated/unwanted? behavioral change because it moves the throw of RowTooBigException up into checkKvSize() ahead of size and batch progress accounting in the scanner context, and no longer updates totalBytesRead

no longer updates totalBytesRead

Use currentInResultRowSizeInByte instead of totalBytesRead. So it doesn't need totalBytesRead.

it moves the throw of RowTooBigException up into checkKvSize() ahead of size and batch progress accounting in the scanner context

I thought it is ok to throw RowToOBigException first because we don't catch this exception and after this exception we don't use this scanner context anymore.
Prefer if a change to add logging only changes the logging.
Attach a v1 patch keep the behavior same with before.

-1 overall

Andrew Purtell Any ideas about the v1 patch?

HConstants being Public, not to add these kind of constants here.

HUGE_KV_SIZE_IN_BYTE_WARN_NAME = "hbase.huge.keyvalue.size.in.byte";

Why KV ref where as we call it Cells these days
We have MOB feature now where each of the Cell might be >1M in size. This is make too many warn logs with def value of 'ase.huge.keyvalue.size.in.byte'. (And also on row size)

HConstants being Public, not to add these kind of constants here.

You mean the constant name or only add it to StoreScanner?

Why KV ref where as we call it Cells these days

They are old code since we use 0.94. I will change this. Thanks.

We have MOB feature now where each of the Cell might be >1M in size.

If i am not wrong, the MOB feature only use MobStoreScanner. This log is for StoreScanner.

Ya the new constants for config name, def value etc should be in StoreScanner only. I see , if MOB uses another path, then that is ok.

kv size:1253360

U want to change the size into more human readable format? (Like 1.2 MB).. Hope all refs to KV will be changed to be Cell.
BTW we have we have a config to specify the max KV size(Ya this is an old config and so KV name there) allowed.'hbase.client.keyvalue.maxsize'. In code its default is -1 means no size limit. But we have this entry in hbase-default.xml means we have this size restriction in place by def. And this is 10 MB. Just saying.

Attach a v2 patch addressed review comments.

BTW we have we have a config to specify the max KV size(Ya this is an old config and so KV name there) allowed.'hbase.client.keyvalue.maxsize'.

hbase.client.keyvalue.maxsize is a client config and you can't control it. The client can set this config to any value. In our use case, this warn log is helpful for cluster manger to find the huge cell.

-1 overall
